title: Random dynamical systems of polynomial automorphisms on $\Bbb{C}^{2}$
abstract:
This paper deals with random dynamical systems of polynomial automorphisms
(complex generalized H\'{e}non maps and their conjugate maps) of $\Bbb{C}^{2}.$
We show that a generic random dynamical system of polynomial automorphisms has
``mean stablity'' on $\Bbb{C}^{2}$. Further, we show that if a system has mean
stability, then (1) for each $z\in \Bbb{C}^{2}$ and for almost every sequence
$\gamma =(\gamma _{n})_{n=1}^{\infty }$ of maps, the Lyapunov exponents of
$\gamma $ at $z$ are negative, (2) there are only finitely many minimal sets of
the system, (3) each minimal set is attracting, and (4) for each $z\in
\Bbb{C}^{2}$ and for almost every sequence $\gamma $ of maps, the orbit $\{
\gamma _{n}\cdots \gamma _{1}(z) \} _{n=1}^{\infty }$ tends to one of the
minimal sets of the system. Note that (1)--(4) cannot hold for any
deterministic iteration dynamical system of a single complex generalized
H\'{e}non map. We observe many new phenomena in random dynamical systems of
polynomial automorphisms of $\Bbb{C}^{2}$ and observe the mechanisms. We
provide new strategies and methods to study higher-dimensional random
holomorphic dynamical systems.
